result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L. Vargas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L. Vargas was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 13CF16.  Probation may be transferred to Illinois.

miscConds.notes: Bond applied - Balance still to be collected

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not have contact with Robert V, Kennedy V, (children may initiate, if desired), unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Vargas

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise. Victim present in court.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  926 -   Victim rights compliance. Parties have reviewed PSI. Victim statement. Sentence recommendations.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions concurrent to 13CF16.  Probation may be transferred to Illinois.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs ordered. Voters rights, Firearms warning, Appeal rights given.
Acknowledgment of plea offer/agreement

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  913 - Matter is now resolved.   Victim rights compliance. DE enters plea of no contest to Ct 3 - found guilty by the Court. All remaining counts dismissed outright. PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 09:30 am.
FP rescheduled to trail 13CF16.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Burgoyne

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  837 - Parties request JT on 13CF16.   Victim rights compliance. All witness lists and motions in limine to be filed by 9/26/16. This case to trail.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Frank Parise.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  205 - Previous counsel, Hans Koesser, present in court. Substitution of atty requested - granted. Atty Koesser is removed from case.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 028:30 am.
Atty Frank Parise

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty Hans Koesser.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  905 - Atty Koesser reports he will likely no longer be representing the DE. Atty Parise to take over. Adjournment requested - granted.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty Hans Koesser.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  135 - Resolution still being negotiated. Atty Koesser reports DE wishes to retain a new attorney. Matters requested to be scheduled for STC - granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty Hans Koesser.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  906 - Matter heard with 13CF369, 13CF16. Atty Wells reports that he may not try this case due to a conflict. Attorneys believe a resolution may be possible - STC requested. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Hans Koesser.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  929 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter heard with 13CF369, 13CF16.  Case bumped for Speedy Trial Demand case.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:48am-  Matter heard with 13CF16 & 13CF369.  Matters are not resolved.  State requests matter be set on the trial calendar.  Court sets 13CF16 for trial - this case to trail.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hans Koesser.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case trails 13CF16.  Status conf. 11/9/15 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:27am-  Matter heard with 13CF16 & 13CF369.  Due to another trial proceeding, Court adjourns trial in 13CF16 to October 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.  This case continues to trail.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:45am-  Matter heard with 13CF16 & 13CF369.  Discussion held re: motions in limine & witness lists in 13CF16.  Matter remains on the court's calendar for 8/3/2015 at 9am.  Bond continued.
Further proceedings on August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Robert L. Vargas, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Matter adjourned, trails 13CF16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Voluntary appearance scheduled for 4/28/2015 at 8:30am at the request of Attorney Koesser.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:37pm-  Matter heard with 13CF16 & 14CF369.  Attorney Koesser does not have an explanation for why the DE is not present.  Based on the DE's non-appearance, Court issues a bench warrant in 13CF16 & takes no action in this case.  Internal review scheduled.  4/27/2015 FP removed from the court's calendar.
02-16-15 Status Conference rescheduled to 04-27-15 as stipulated by ADA Zapf and Atty Koesser.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10am-  Matter heard with 13CF16 & 13CF369.  State is requesting an adjournment of the trial in 13CF16.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm at the request of the parties.  Status conference adjourned to February 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Status conference on December 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Due to a conflict w/ the court's calendar, 9/22/2014 Status conference is rescheduled to 12/8/2014 at 9am.  Parties notified via email.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:26am-  Matter heard with 13CF16 & 13CF369.  Attorney Koesser is requesting the JT in 13CF16 be adjourned.  State does not object.  Court grants request.  This case to continue to trail.  Status conference adjourned to September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:49am-  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Matter heard with 13CF369 & 13CF16.  Victim rights compliance.  Parties are jointly requesting an adjournment of the trial in 13CF16 & 13CF369.  Court grants request.  This case to trail 13CF16.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 09:30 am & July 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Hans Koesser. Clerk LE. Judicial notice taken of the bond conditions in 13CF369 and 13CF16. KSD Deputy Jonathan Scifres sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Koesser. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-2-14 @ 9:00am with 13CF369 and 13CF16. Bond continued.
Atty Hans Koesser

243 p.m.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Perz.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/24/14 @ 9 a.m.   $250 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
